alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; Mower (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 12 at 10:37PM CDT until April 12 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Mitchell County in north central Iowa... Northwestern Howard County in northeastern Iowa... Southeastern Mower County in southeastern Minnesota... Southwestern Fillmore County in southeastern Minnesota... * Until 1100 PM CDT. * At 1037 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Stacyville, or 11 miles north of Osage, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Adams around 1050 PM CDT. Le Roy around 1100 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Lake Louise State Park, Chester, Meyer, Taopi, County Roads 4 And 3, Johnsburg and County Roads 4 And 8. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
